comments.body: NOPE! Noone will be able to download any Texture pack. Very bad idea! I have a personal Texture pack for my own use only that mixes different Textures from many Texture Packs.

@ChrisCuomo anyone will still be able to download or use any resource pack, as it could be an optional feature enabled if the creator wants, there will be a lot of packs that do not use them, but if you want to use a mix of packs that are encrypted just install all of them at the same time, and the ones that are on top will be the ones that have prefference. Or you could also ask the creator to get permission to use the files you want/need.
This is a TERRIBLE Idea. A lot of UI creators would do this and it would destroy other people's ability to learn ui modding, or scripting!

I have to agree with the majority here. If you discover a new way to make addons you should want to share it with the community so better quality addons begin popping up. Encrypting the code would ruin the community. I‚Äôm sorry. I see where your coming from. But the fact of the matter is, the Minecraft addon community thrives off of being able to learn from each other.

 

I have a perfect example of why this would not be as great as you might think. Take the dragon addons floating around the community, for instance. Right now they‚Äôre a bit lackluster due to not manny knowing how to make a controllable land to air mob. However! There is an addon that exists on the market place who‚Äôs creators figured it out. Unfortunately, due to all marketplace maps being encrypted, no one is able to learn the mechanics used to make that happen. It doesn‚Äôt help that those addons are tied to the maps they come with due to this encryption. Meaning you are stuck using one of the best dragon addons on a specific map and will never see it on your custom world.

I understand you don‚Äôt want your work republished but I never want to see that specific solution ever enter the community. You own rights to the addon itself, you ‚Äúdo not‚Äù own the common code used to make your addon work. That will forever be owned by the devs. (You have rights over the LEGO creation not rights to the specific bricks used in building it)

In my opinion, I think it is a good idea. I dont think everyone want others know the content he wrote, especially because there are a number of people who often steal other's add-on and published them as if the add-on made by himself. If so, it may discourage those who actually made this add-on.

    My advice is that add a function which allow add-on maker to make a decision whether the add-on would be encrypted. It is easy to do so, there would be a specified private key inside minecraft application while publish the public key. Add-on makers can encrypt their pack with the public key and publish it,  after the encrypted pack imported in minecraft,  minecraft decrypt it automatically with the private key.

As someone who is new to add-on creation, this scares me the most; having my pack done by hand and all after countless sleepless nights, only to see someone uploading it without credits or heck, customizing a bit and uploading it back, only to say that it was their original creation...

@TheMcExplorer Yes, you take away a method for people to learn but this is the perfect way to teach people to NOT take away other people's work.

I'm incredibly new to modding, and I learned how to make my own mods from opening other's files but I have never stolen anyone else's files and claimed it as mine because we all know that is just unfair.

To solve your problem, we just really have to remember that there is a community out there who works hard to make mods whenever they get the chance to. I'd even gladly teach others the same way I made my mods, because with all sincerity, I think I've done a really great job with my mods. I haven't uploaded them yet, because of the risk of plagiarism.

I see people saying don't, and people saying to do it.   I personally want a way to stop plagiarism.  I'm never uploading anything of mine until this bs is resolved. By the way, I thought about it, and... if you look in  settings>storage>cache,  you'll see you now have the resource and behavior packs of worlds you joined, and then can do the same and steal that persons work.  I feel they should find a way to keep that, but remove that as a feature as well.  It can become problematic, and I have serious anxiety over this garbage!!!!

This seems like an impractical proposal that won't actually solve plagiarism. It's impossible to allow players to play the addon without also providing them the means to decrypt the addon. There will always be someone who looks for (and finds) a way to access this means without permission. Once that happens we have the worst of both worlds. People willing to break the law will plagiarise using the key while people who are just looking to learn techniques are unable to do so.
What about signing it with cerficates.
On bedrock edition, things from the marketplace are encrypted (or at least the json files)...

As a fellow creator I would indeed love to have an encryption feature.
Now I know you can do it using some java encyptor where it would still be read in java, but Windows File Explorer can't open or unzip the file.

There's been many times my work has been stolen. So yes I'd love to have this since I've yet to get the corrupted file to work.

All the other commenters here thinking it's a bad idea, just imagine your work getting stolen and sold onward without you knowing.

This is sooooo important! Instead of arguing here though, we should actually find a way to do this. It should up to the creator whether they want to encrypt it or not. If anyone knows a way to do this, please share! I know dakonblackrose found a way to do it but then the website shut down.
Definitely good. remember programs are also encrypted but yet they have a big community support like stack over flow. Adding encryption to packs wont disturb community.
DO NOT ADD THIS! This would be DRM and DRM is EVIL.

There has been a case back in Late 2021 and 2022 where the 32x Faithful pack has been stolen from user Vattic on Reddit and sold on the Marketplace. The one user who stole the pack was xMrVizzy. This is why creators should be allowed to encrypt their packs.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/4930497759885-Remove-Faithful-From-the-marketplace

The reason why I got into this in the first place is because I wanted to decrypt the Hermitcraft Season 9 map from the marketplace so that I could use Chunker to convert it to a Java world so that I could see what the custom heads actually look like when the work. I think that they should have decrypted the map. It is free after all. So, I think that Minecraft should not encrypt worlds from the Marketplace that you can get for free.

I was thinking about new boss in minecraft with dimension, too. The dimensions name is Ancient, with old stone underground castle ruins. There is a boss, that spawns with end crystal in the specific obsidian. For the first time there I four bedrock in specific slots, but when the player kills the boss, the experience points will take you to lvl 5. Also it drops 8 bedrock block, so you can place four still on that slots, place end crystal in the obsidian and resoawn that boss. Its name is Super Golem, that has 600hp and deals 100hp damage. He has four kinds of attacks: he can jump on 4 blocks with damage 100hp, he can throw bedrock blocks ranged attack, with 100hp damage, he can attack you in melee combat with three punches, each one deals 100hp, and he can dash right through you and you friends, and dashing is on 6 blocks long, 3 blocks wide and 4 blocks high, and deals 100hp. The boss's sizes are: hight - 3 blocks, wide - 3 blocks, and ,,long" - three blocks. So he has square wide and long. Oh, yeah, players can't win against him that powerful. Well, they can use strategy, with which they must trap themselves with a little gap, and place water pitfall at the outside of that gapped wall. In that dimension, like beds explode in end and nether, water is poisonous, and takes lots of damage. So the boss will fall in, you attack with gap, so it can't reach you and water does extra damage role. So you can beat it with this strategy.
That dimension is like a stronghold - a maze

Hello Mojang team,

I have some ideas that I believe would be fun additions to Minecraft and that fit well within the existing style of the game:

  • Echo Potion Brewing: A new brewing mechanic where echo shards can be used to enhance or combine potions in unique ways (like combining Speed + Invisibility or extending effects further).

  • Cursed Totem: A new totem that, instead of saving you, activates after death to punish the killer (e.g. slowness, blindness, or bad omen).

  • Shulker Cluster Block: A late-game utility block that can store and access multiple shulker boxes from a single container ‚Äî essentially a ‚Äúcluster‚Äù of shulkers for advanced organization.

  • Stats Logbook: A new item that shows all stats like mobs killed, items mined, and boss defeats, in a collectible book form to track your progress over time.

I hope you find these ideas interesting! Thank you for your time.

Here is all my update ideas.

The Void Dimension Update

  • Adds a mysterious new realm with gravity shifts and time distortion.

  • Mobs: Echo Golems, Void Wisps, Shadow Serpents.

Pillager Expansion: Rise of the Polems

  • Introduces Polems (Pillager Golems) like Ironbane, Hexolem, and Warolem.

  • New raid mechanics, siege towers, and Pillager Foundries.

Overgrown Wilds Biome Update

  • Jungle ruins, Blooming Vines, and Jungle Spirits.

  • Plant growth overtakes structures over time.

Frozen Depths Biome Update

  • Glacial caves, Crystal Yetis, and Blue Ice Ore.

  • Freezing terrain and thermal gear crafting.

Desert Kingdoms Update

  • Sandstone fortresses, Tomb Guardians, and Scarab Swarms.

  • Sandstorms and ancient loot.

Magic & Enchanting Overhaul

  • Arcane Forge, spells, runes, and magical weapons.

  • New enchantment fusion system.

Combat & Armor Update

  • New armor types, dual wielding, and combat styles.

  • Training dummies and gear testing.

Pet & Taming Update

  • New pets like Foxhounds and Mini-Golems.

  • Pet gear, training, and bonding mechanics.

Builder‚Äôs Paradise Update

  • New decorative blocks, blueprint tools, and auto-build drones.

  • Hanging plants, animated paintings, and custom signs.

Mutation Update

  • Mutated mobs with random traits and powers.

  • Mutagen Pools and crafting extracts.

Exploration Overhaul

  • Compass upgrades, terrain scanners, and fog-of-war maps.

  • Explorer camps, watchtowers, and loot-sniffing Trail Hounds.

I was sitting down with my wife as she was playing another game. I looked over and in her other game they had bags of peanuts. I immediately said to her, ‚ÄúIt would be awesome if we could have peanuts in Minecraft.‚Äù Maybe bags of boiled peanuts! Instead of cooking them in the smoker or furnace, we can place a cauldron overtop a campfire to create boiling water. Then we can add option for certain plants and items to boil for food. Maybe make ‚Äúlarge batch‚Äù potion in the cauldron as well.

Hear me out: Enderpearl potion‚Ä¶ (or Pearl Potion)
>>> How to obtain?
It can be brewed from an Awkward Potion and Endermite Glands. This will be a new drop from the overly underwhelming Endermite. When an Endermite is killed, it has a 33% chance (Looting enchantment applies) to drop its Endermite Glands.
The normal potion recipes apply (duration, level, splash and lingering).

>>> Effect

>> No potion

Enderpearl:
‚Äì Regular enderpearl behavior (travels ~51.5 blocks with an optimal launch angle of ~40¬∞).

Eye of Ender:
‚Äì 20% chance of shattering and an 80% chance of surviving per throw.

>> Level 1 Potion

Enderpearl:
‚Äì Damage received from thrown enderpearl √ó 0.5
‚Äì Travel distance √ó 2 (~150 blocks with an optimal launch angle of ~40¬∞)

Eye of Ender:
‚Äì 10% chance of shattering and a 90% chance of surviving per throw.

>> Level 2 Potion

Enderpearl:
‚Äì Damage received from thrown enderpearl √ó 0
‚Äì Travel distance √ó 2 (~250 blocks with an optimal launch angle of ~40¬∞)

Eye of Ender:
‚Äì 100% chance of surviving per throw.

>> Balancing

The Endermite is quite rare, with only a 5% chance of spawning from an Enderpearl. Combined with the 33% chance of dropping Endermite Glands (without Looting), the effects remain balanced.

>> Loot tables

Pearl Potions have a small chance to generate in End Cities.

Agreguen una nueva estructura a los bosques p√°lidos, una estructura llamada "La Torre de la Luna P√°lida".

*Descripci√≥n:*
La Torre de la Luna P√°lida es una estructura alta y delgada que se eleva hacia el cielo, rodeada de √°rboles p√°lidos y flores de luna. La torre est√° hecha de bloques de piedra p√°lida y tiene una escalera en espiral que conduce a la cima, donde se encuentra un faro que emite una luz p√°lida y misteriosa.

*Caracter√≠sticas:*

- La torre tiene una altura de 20-30 bloques y un di√°metro de 5-7 bloques.
- La escalera en espiral est√° hecha de bloques de madera p√°lida y tiene antorchas que iluminan el camino.
- El faro en la cima emite una luz p√°lida que se puede ver desde lejos y atrae a los jugadores a explorar la torre.
- La torre est√° rodeada de un jard√≠n de flores de luna y √°rboles p√°lidos, creando un ambiente m√°gico y misterioso.
- En el interior de la torre, hay un laboratorio abandonado con equipos y libros que contienen secretos sobre la historia de los bosques p√°lidos.

*Prop√≥sito:*
La Torre de la Luna P√°lida podr√≠a ser un lugar de inter√©s para los jugadores que buscan explorar y descubrir secretos en los bosques p√°lidos. Tambi√©n podr√≠a ser un punto de referencia para los jugadores que se pierden en el bosque, ya que la luz del faro se puede ver desde lejos.

A new craftable block item called the Extractor .Craftable by 2 obsidian ,1 Diamond Block and 6 Stone .It's job is to remove enchantments from certain equipment onto books or other equipment for example I have an iron sword with mending and sharpness IV but I need those enchantments on my netherite sword .I can extract the magic from the iron sword and place it directly onto my netherite sword
New Item Chainsaw .it can be crafted by 3 chains and a mineral eg stone, iron ,diamond etc .It cuts wood waaay faster than any axe and has a feature to directly convert the wood into planks

Cowabunga .Everyone loves boats but aren't they a bit too slow and the waters in minecraft can often be too plain .That's why I have the idea of introducing waves to large oceans and a new mode of transportation fo traverse these waves...the surfboard .Crafted by 3 wooden planks it can move at incredible speed on water though only one player can ride it at a time and can be combined with banners for sweet designs and uniqueness .

I suppose a solution would be to access OneDrive through Minecraft and have an option to launch .mc(insert type here) files from a menu listing all found files of those types.

This could possibly also apply to other versions, such as the IOS version, the Switch version, and the PS version, but would realistically be tied only to the Xbox version.

If Microsoft accounts aren't tied to Xbox accounts, you'd be asked to sign into OneDrive instead, since they still share the fact that they're Microsoft owned services/games.

Shulker boxes and ender chests are already ‚Äúbackpacks‚Äù

Bu for those who like to travel or can‚Äôt find end villages or just haven‚Äôt gone to the end a backpack is a great idea for those who just started the game and need extra storage because sometimes your inventory gets for on your way somewhere and you have to leave things behind just to get new things ether on your way home or to a village I think backpacks should definitely be added
Backpacks are to OP. Ender chests and Shulker boxes should be as hard to obtain as they already are.

This is how it will work with out making it to OP for us survival builders. A backpack would hold 9 (18 at the most slots) they take up a chest piece and you can't get goods without sacrificing that slot.they can be dyed and They have durability if it breaks your stuff goes flying every where.

That is the bare minimum backpack mechanics.

If there were more advanced mechanics, you could add a piece of leather to the pack to give it more slots start with 4 end at 9. Start at 9 end at 18, you could also add armor for more protection in the upgrade table (iron diamond up to netherite) but it is always going to be less than the chest plate and have durability granted you could put mending on it which is why it has to and would be less than a shulker.

I'd like to see backpacks implemented as a chestplate alternative. The trade-off for a chest / double-chest worth of storage is less armor / protection in a similar method the elytra trades protection for flight. A player should be able to click on it the backpack in their hand to open it and expand their storage, or if possible add a button map to open the backpack while wearing it.

Don't get me wrong, the Shulker-Boxes / Ender Chest combo is great, but it's very much and end-game form of storage expansion. A major drawback is that you have to place down your Ender Chest, open it up and take out a Shulker-Box, and then place down the Shulker-Box to open it up and access that inventory. This is a fine trade-off for a large amount of storage created by this system I think, but it isn't feasible early or mid game prior to the player reaching the end. And for those of us who just want extra storage to carry / collect more stuff it doesn't work.

Bundles are a great step forward I think, but the drawback is they only hold a random assortment of 64 items. Again, this is a great addition to storage, especially for the early game or when you're exploring. But this doesn't help when your collecting resources or mining and have stacks upon stacks of stuff, which is where backpacks would come in handy for early / mid game as extra storage.

The main reason that Java Edition wasn't on last gen consoles, is because, Java coding is harder, for a CPU to run, compared to C++ coding (which is what Bedrock Edition is). The last gen consoles CPUs, and amount of ram were most likely not sufficient, to run Minecraft Java. The next gen consoles, however, are more than capable of running this, having a better CPU, than most PC players, and 16GB of ram. Java edition is better, in many aspects, in my opinion, and I would be overjoyed, if Java came, to console!
